text: I am thankful for the Word of God, I'm thankful for the truth that God has given us in His Word. The title for the message this morning is found in verse number 18 of our text of Scripture. The Bible says, My little children, let us not love in word, neither in tongue, but in deed and in truth. I've titled the message this morning, Love in Deed and in Truth. It's interesting, a recurring subject in the book of 1 John is that of brotherly love. We find that John first visited this particular subject matter in 1 John chapter number 2, verses 7 through 11. But notice here, in Romans chapter number 12, we deal with the love that we're to have, this brotherly love that is described for us in the Word of God. This is something that is supernatural. This is something that is reserved to the individual that has been born again, that's been saved by the blood of Jesus Christ. This morning, as we look at this text of Scripture, and we're reminded of this statement that we're to love in deed and in truth. Let me say this as I wrap it up.
